ratings.comment: To offer a more pessimistic rating, I would not recommend this professor at all. There were only two grades for the entire class, so if one grade is poor, then the final course grade will also be poor. Minimal work though, none of the reading mattered besides the terms. The term paper at the end is tough, so get a head start on it!

The 2.5 hour lecture does get long, but he is a very knowledgeable person.  HIs past experiences allow him to go more in-depth on topics other professors don't.  However, lecture is very boring.  You have a midterm that is wroth 40% of your grade and a 20-30 page term paper.  Study the lecture and terms from the book and you'll get an A.
Don't be put off by the 2.5 hour lecture. He has so much real experience in the field that his lectures are always fascinating. Even though he seems super formal, he is very kind and willing to help.

The material wasn't thrilling, but that being said Shafer is a very knowledgable professor and I would definitely recommend him. The class consisted of a midterm, a final paper, and a final exam... which was cancelled (based on what the class voted on). Start the paper early, 20 page minimum requires a lot of work.
Very enjoyable and interesting guy, class was a little boring but overall worth it. One midterm, which was pretty easy and a 25-30 page paper. Overall pretty good class.

Professor Shafer knows a lot about American government.  However, class was fairly boring (due to long lecture).  Mid term was pretty easy, and the class votes whether or not to have a final after midterms.  20-30 page research paper also due the day of the final...ouch!

I took him for Intro to American Politics for Honors and it was a fairly easy class.  A 25-30 page research paper is about the only major thing to worry about.  His tests are not very hard and the books are not used at all. He assigns readings but very little comes from there that he doesn't cover in lecture.  Very nice guy too!

Byron is awesome!  if you want a future in American Gov't, take his classes and get on his good side ~> he is VERY well known, and very friendly & funny once you get to know him.  don't be put off by his formality.
Seems like a review of 9th Grade civics for most of it.  Hard to stay awake.
